## Table of Contents

* [`syslogng`](#syslogng): Syslog_ng  Install and configure syslog_ng client
* [`syslogng::params`](#syslogngparams): Syslogng::Params  Params pattern for syslogng

## Classes

### syslogng

Syslog_ng

Install and configure syslog_ng client

#### Parameters

The following parameters are available in the `syslogng` class.

##### `log_destination`

Data type: `Any`

hostname to send logs to

##### `port`

Data type: `Any`

port to send logs to

Default value: $syslogng::params::port

##### `managed`

Data type: `Any`

True to manage syslog-ng with this module otherwise do nothing

Default value: $syslogng::params::managed

##### `enabled`

Data type: `Any`

True to enable and start the syslog-ng daemon otherwise false

Default value: $syslogng::params::enabled

##### `config_file`

Data type: `Any`

Configuration file to edit

Default value: $syslogng::params::config_file

##### `service`

Data type: `Any`

Name of the service to managed

Default value: $syslogng::params::service

##### `package`

Data type: `Any`

Name of the package to install

Default value: $syslogng::params::package

##### `comment`

Data type: `Any`

Comment to add before our modification to the syslog config file

Default value: $syslogng::params::comment

##### `log_reference`

Data type: `Any`

Override the default log_reference (log source)

Default value: $syslogng::params::log_reference

### syslogng::params

Syslogng::Params

Params pattern for syslogng
